ground_truth: Jenny takes a gold necklace out of a box, but wagging his tail playfully, Marley gets the necklace. John trips on a chair and the chase is on around the living room. The dog easily outmaneuvers Jenny, but John grabs him and forces open his jaws. John sprays Marley's poop with a hose, looking for the necklace. The doctor holds a probe to Jenny's stomach and moves a scanner around on gel on Jenny's stomach. A fuzzy picture appears on a screen, but the doctor frowns and removes the scanner, then walks out, leaving the Grogans waiting anxiously in the examination room. The doctor returns, smiles reassuringly, and places the scanner on Jenny's stomach. Jenny nods, tight-lipped, and the doctor withdraws with a sympathetic smile of apology. Jenny glances at her husband, who's lost for words as they drive down a palm tree-lined road. John glances at Jenny and gropes to break the silence; without looking at him, she settles back against her headrest and stares out of the window. They drive on down the sunny freeway toward the city. Back home, John opens the front door for his wife. Marley jumps up at him, but he pushes the dog aside. Jenny shrugs and slumps onto the sofa. Eyes full of concern, John turns around from filling the kettle at the sink. Jenny sits blankly, petting Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. As she starts to cry, she leans forward and hugs the big Labrador. John walks over and sits next to her, stroking her back, and she leans against him as he rubs her arm soothingly. A young dark-haired woman gets out carrying a bag and a suitcase, and Marley chases Debbie around the house trying to pull off her bath towel; he wins the game. Debbie offers the sedatives, and Marley's eating the sofa. The elderly Irish landlady leaves them to their quaintly decorated twin room, and John winces at the noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They kiss, snuggled in the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. A yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home, and the house is a chewed mess. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail, and then stands with his head tilted back at a rain-lashed window. The dog runs under the desk where John's working and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny comes out of the bathroom holding up a pregnancy kit, and John takes her in his arms, lifting her clean off the floor. The Grogans are asleep as Marley busies himself chewing some of John's socks, and then he headbutts open his food bin, knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A gold necklace is taken out of a box by Jenny, but the necklace is gotten by Marley, wagging his tail playfully. John trips on a chair, and the chase begins around the living room. Jenny is easily outmaneuvered by the dog, but Marley is grabbed by John, who forces open his jaws. Marley's poop is sprayed with a hose by John, who looks for the necklace. Jenny's stomach is held with a probe by the doctor, and gel on her stomach is scanned by the doctor. A fuzzy picture is shown on a screen, but the scanner is removed by the doctor, who frowns and then walks out, leaving the Grogans waiting anxiously in the examination room. The doctor returns, smiles reassuringly, and Jenny's stomach is scanned again by the doctor. A nod is given by Jenny, tight-lipped, and the doctor withdraws with a sympathetic smile of apology. Her husband is glanced at by Jenny, who's lost for words as the palm tree-lined road is driven down by them. Jenny is glanced at by John, who gropes to break the silence; without looking at him, she settles back against her headrest and stares out of the window. The sunny freeway is driven on by them toward the city. The front door is opened by John for his wife at home. Marley jumps up at him, but the dog is pushed aside by him. A shrug is given by Jenny as she slumps onto the sofa. Eyes full of concern, John turns around from filling the kettle at the sink. Blankly, Jenny sits, petting Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. The big Labrador is hugged by her, leaning forward as she starts to cry. John walks over and sits next to her, stroking her back, and against him, she leans as her arm is rubbed soothingly by him. A young dark-haired woman carries a bag and a suitcase out, and around the house, Marley chases Debbie, trying to pull off her bath towel; the game is won by him. The sedatives are offered by Debbie, and Marley eats the sofa. Their quaintly decorated twin room is left by the elderly Irish landlady for them, and the noise of the springs is winced at by John as the bed is sat on by Jenny. They kiss, snuggled in the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. The Grogans' home is arrived at by a yellow taxi, and the house is a chewed mess. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail, and then stands with his head tilted back at a rain-lashed window. Under the desk where John works, the dog runs and climbs onto John's lap. Out of the bathroom, Jenny comes holding up a pregnancy kit, and she is taken in John's arms, who lifts her clean off the floor. Marley busies himself chewing some of John's socks as the Grogans sleep, and the food bin is headbutted open by him, knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Jenny takes a gold necklace from a box, but Marley playfully grabs it. John trips on a chair, sparking a chase around the living room. The dog outmaneuvers Jenny, but John catches him and forces open his jaws. John sprays Marley's poop with a hose, searching for the necklace. At the doctor's, a probe and scanner reveal a fuzzy picture on a screen. The doctor frowns, leaves, then returns with a reassuring smile, placing the scanner on Jenny's stomach again. Jenny nods, tight-lipped, and the doctor departs with an apologetic smile. As they drive down a palm-lined road, John tries to break the silence, but Jenny stares out the window. Back home, John opens the door for Jenny, who slumps onto the sofa. Concerned, John watches her pet Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. She starts crying, hugs Marley, and John sits beside her, soothingly rubbing her arm. A young woman, Debbie, arrives with a bag and suitcase, and Marley chases her, pulling off her towel. Debbie offers sedatives as Marley chews the sofa. The elderly landlady shows them to a quaint twin room, and John winces at the bed's springs as Jenny sits. They kiss under a floral quilt beneath a Virgin Mary portrait. A yellow taxi arrives at their chewed-up home. Marley stands at the door, then at a rain-lashed window. He runs under John's desk, climbs onto his lap, and Jenny emerges with a pregnancy kit. John lifts her off the floor in joy. As the Grogans sleep, Marley chews John's socks and headbutts his food bin, knocking books off a shelf.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jenny takes a gold necklace from a box, but Marley playfully grabs it. John trips on a chair, starting a chase around the living room. Marley outmaneuvers Jenny, but John catches him and forces his jaws open. John sprays Marley's poop with a hose, searching for the necklace. A doctor scans Jenny's stomach, but frowns and leaves the Grogans waiting anxiously. Returning, the doctor reassures them, but Jenny remains tight-lipped. Driving down a palm-lined road, John tries to break the silence, but Jenny stares out the window. At home, John opens the door, pushing Marley aside. Jenny slumps on the sofa, petting Marley, and starts crying. John comforts her, stroking her back. A young woman, Debbie, arrives, and Marley chases her, winning a game. Debbie offers sedatives as Marley eats the sofa. An elderly landlady shows them to a twin room, and John winces at the bed's springs. They kiss under a floral quilt. A taxi arrives at their chewed-up home. Marley wags his tail at the door, then looks out a rain-lashed window. He runs under John's desk, climbs onto his lap, and Jenny shows a pregnancy kit. John lifts her joyfully. As the Grogans sleep, Marley chews socks, headbutts his food bin, and knocks books off a shelf.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Jenny carefully takes a delicate gold necklace out of a small, ornate box, but Marley, wagging his tail playfully and full of mischief, quickly snatches the necklace away. John, in his haste, trips over a chair, and thus begins a lively chase around the spacious living room. The dog, with his agile movements, easily outmaneuvers Jenny, but John manages to catch him and pries open his jaws to retrieve the necklace. Later, John is seen outside, diligently spraying Marley's poop with a hose, hoping to find the missing necklace. Meanwhile, at the doctor's office, the doctor holds a probe to Jenny's stomach, moving a scanner around on the gel applied to her skin. A fuzzy image appears on the screen, but the doctor frowns, removes the scanner, and exits the room, leaving the Grogans waiting anxiously in the quiet examination room. The doctor soon returns, offering a reassuring smile, and places the scanner back on Jenny's stomach. Jenny nods, her lips tight with concern, and the doctor withdraws with a sympathetic smile of apology. As they drive down a palm tree-lined road, Jenny glances at her husband, who is at a loss for words. John, trying to break the silence, glances at Jenny, but she simply leans back against her headrest, staring out of the window. They continue driving down the sunny freeway toward the bustling city. Once back home, John opens the front door for his wife. Marley eagerly jumps up at him, but John gently pushes the dog aside. Jenny shrugs and slumps onto the sofa, feeling the weight of the day. With eyes full of concern, John turns around from filling the kettle at the sink. Jenny sits there blankly, petting Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. As tears begin to fall, she leans forward and hugs the big, comforting Labrador. John walks over and sits next to her, gently stroking her back, and she leans against him as he rubs her arm soothingly. A young, dark-haired woman arrives, carrying a bag and a suitcase, and Marley, ever playful, chases Debbie around the house, trying to pull off her bath towel; he wins the game. Debbie offers the sedatives, and Marley, in his usual antics, is found eating the sofa. The elderly Irish landlady shows them to their quaintly decorated twin room, and John winces at the noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They share a tender kiss, snuggled under the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed, beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. A yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home, revealing the house in a chewed-up mess. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail, and then gazes with his head tilted back at a rain-lashed window. The dog runs under the desk where John is working and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny emerges from the bathroom, holding up a pregnancy kit, and John, overjoyed, takes her in his arms, lifting her clean off the floor. As the Grogans sleep peacefully, Marley busies himself chewing on some of John's socks, and then he headbutts open his food bin, knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Jenny, with meticulous care and attention, gently removes a delicate and exquisite gold necklace from a small, ornate box that has been beautifully crafted. However, Marley, who is energetically wagging his tail and brimming with playful mischief, swiftly snatches the precious necklace away. In his rush and eagerness, John accidentally trips over a chair, and thus initiates an animated and lively chase around the spacious and airy living room. The dog, with his quick and nimble movements, easily outmaneuvers Jenny, evading her attempts to catch him, but John eventually manages to seize the mischievous canine and gently pries open his jaws to retrieve the precious necklace. Later on, John is seen outside in the yard, diligently spraying water onto Marley's poop with a hose, earnestly hoping to find the necklace that went missing. 

Meanwhile, in the quiet confines of the doctor's office, the doctor holds a medical probe to Jenny's stomach, carefully moving a scanner around the gel that has been applied to her skin. A fuzzy image gradually appears on the monitor, but the doctor frowns, removes the scanner with a concerned expression, and exits the room, leaving the Grogans waiting in anxious anticipation in the silent examination room. The doctor soon returns, offering a reassuring smile, and places the scanner back on Jenny's stomach. Jenny nods in understanding, her lips pressed tightly with worry, as the doctor withdraws with a sympathetic smile, silently apologizing. As they drive along a road lined with tall palm trees, Jenny glances at her husband, who finds himself at a loss for words. John, attempting to break the uneasy silence, glances over at Jenny, but she simply leans back against her headrest, staring thoughtfully out of the window. They continue driving down the bright, sunny freeway toward the bustling cityscape. Once back home, John courteously opens the front door for his wife. Marley, full of energy, eagerly jumps up at him, but John gently pushes the enthusiastic dog aside. Jenny gives a small shrug and slumps onto the soft sofa, feeling the heavy weight of the day settling in.

With eyes brimming with concern, John turns around from where he stands, filling the kettle with water at the kitchen sink. Jenny sits there quietly, lost in thought, petting Marley, who rests his chin lovingly on her knee. As tears start to fall, she leans forward and wraps her arms around the large, comforting Labrador. John walks over and sits beside her, gently stroking her back to comfort her, and she leans against him as he soothingly rubs her arm. A young, dark-haired woman arrives at the house, carrying a bag and a suitcase, and Marley, ever playful and full of energy, chases Debbie around the house, trying to pull off her bath towel; in the end, he wins the playful game. Debbie offers the sedatives, and Marley, true to his usual antics, is found mischievously chewing on the sofa. The elderly Irish landlady then shows them to their quaintly decorated twin room, and John winces at the squeaky noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They share a tender and loving kiss, snuggled together under the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed, beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary.

A yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home, revealing the house to be in a chewed-up mess due to Marley's antics. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail enthusiastically, and then gazes with his head tilted back at the rain-lashed window. The playful dog runs under the desk where John is diligently working and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny emerges from the bathroom, triumphantly holding up a pregnancy kit, and John, overwhelmed with joy, takes her in his arms, lifting her clean off the floor in celebration. As the Grogans sleep peacefully, Marley busies himself by chewing on some of John's socks, and then he uses his head to butt open his food bin, inadvertently knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jenny carefully opens a box and gently takes out a gold necklace, admiring it for a moment before Marley, their playful dog, suddenly appears, wagging his tail with excitement. In a swift motion, Marley snatches the necklace from Jenny's hand, prompting John to react quickly. As John moves to intercept Marley, he accidentally trips over a chair, causing a brief stumble, and thus begins a lively chase around the living room. Marley, with his agile movements, easily outmaneuvers Jenny, darting around furniture and evading her grasp. However, John manages to catch up to Marley, firmly grabbing him and prying open his jaws to retrieve the necklace. Later, John is outside, diligently spraying Marley's poop with a hose, hoping to find the missing necklace. Meanwhile, at the doctor's office, the doctor applies a cool gel to Jenny's stomach and moves a scanner over it, concentrating on the screen as a fuzzy image appears. The doctor frowns slightly, removes the scanner, and exits the room, leaving Jenny and John waiting anxiously. After a tense moment, the doctor returns with a reassuring smile, places the scanner back on Jenny's stomach, and Jenny nods, her expression tight-lipped. The doctor then withdraws with a sympathetic smile, leaving Jenny to glance at her husband, who is momentarily speechless as they drive down a palm tree-lined road. John, sensing the silence, glances at Jenny, trying to find words, but she simply leans back against her headrest, gazing out of the window as they continue down the sunny freeway toward the city. Once back home, John opens the front door for Jenny, and Marley enthusiastically jumps up at him, but John gently pushes the dog aside. Jenny, feeling weary, shrugs and slumps onto the sofa. John, eyes full of concern, turns from the sink where he is filling the kettle and sees Jenny sitting blankly, petting Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. As tears begin to well up in her eyes, Jenny leans forward, embracing the big Labrador for comfort. John walks over, sits beside her, and tenderly strokes her back, offering solace as she leans against him, and he rubs her arm soothingly. Meanwhile, a young dark-haired woman steps out of a vehicle, carrying a bag and a suitcase, and Marley, ever playful, chases Debbie around the house, attempting to pull off her bath towel, eventually succeeding in his mischievous game. Debbie, in turn, offers sedatives, while Marley busies himself by chewing on the sofa. In a quaintly decorated twin room, the elderly Irish landlady leaves John and Jenny, and as Jenny sits on the bed, the noise of the springs makes John wince. They share a tender kiss, snuggled under the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed, beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. Later, a yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home, revealing a house in disarray, with chewed items scattered about. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail, then moves to a rain-lashed window, tilting his head back to watch the raindrops. The dog then runs under the desk where John is working, climbing onto his lap for attention. Jenny emerges from the bathroom, holding up a pregnancy kit, and John, filled with joy, takes her in his arms, lifting her off the floor in celebration. As night falls, the Grogans are asleep, while Marley, ever the troublemaker, busies himself by chewing on some of John's socks, then headbutts open his food bin, inadvertently knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jenny retrieves a gold necklace from a box, but Marley playfully snatches it, prompting a chase around the living room. John eventually catches Marley and retrieves the necklace. Later, at the doctor's office, a scan of Jenny's stomach initially causes concern, but the doctor reassures them with a smile before leaving. As they drive home, John attempts to break the silence, but Jenny remains distant, staring out the window. Back home, John opens the door for Jenny, who slumps onto the sofa, petting Marley. Overcome with emotion, she begins to cry and hugs the dog. John comforts her, sitting beside her and soothingly rubbing her arm. Meanwhile, a young woman named Debbie arrives, and Marley playfully chases her, eventually winning their game. Debbie offers sedatives as Marley chews on the sofa. At a quaintly decorated room, John and Jenny share a tender moment, snuggled under a floral quilt. A yellow taxi later arrives at their home, revealing a chewed-up mess. Marley, wagging his tail, watches the rain from the window before climbing onto John's lap as he works. Jenny emerges from the bathroom with a pregnancy kit, and John joyfully lifts her off the floor. As the Grogans sleep, Marley mischievously chews on John's socks and knocks over some books while accessing his food bin.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Jenny takes a gold necklace out of a jewelry box designed by a renowned local artisan, but wagging his tail playfully, Marley, an exuberant Labrador retriever known for his mischievous antics, gets the necklace. John, a young father who often finds himself in chaotic situations, trips on a vintage wooden chair and the chase is on around the spacious living room. The dog easily outmaneuvers Jenny, but John grabs him and gently forces open his jaws. John sprays Marley's poop with a hose in the backyard garden, a method he read about in a dog owner's guide, looking for the necklace. The doctor, a seasoned specialist at the local clinic, holds a probe to Jenny's stomach and moves a scanner around on gel on Jenny's stomach. A fuzzy picture appears on a screen, but the doctor frowns and removes the scanner, then walks out, leaving the Grogans, a couple known in their neighborhood for their lively household, waiting anxiously in the examination room. The doctor returns, smiles reassuringly, and places the scanner on Jenny's stomach. Jenny nods, tight-lipped, and the doctor withdraws with a sympathetic smile of apology. Jenny glances at her husband, who's lost for words as they drive down a palm tree-lined road, characteristic of their sunny Florida neighborhood. John glances at Jenny and gropes to break the silence; without looking at him, she settles back against her headrest and stares out of the window at the sprawling cityscape. They drive on down the sunny freeway, a route they often take toward the city. Back home, a modest ranch-style house, John opens the front door for his wife. Marley jumps up at him, but he pushes the dog aside. Jenny shrugs and slumps onto the sofa, an antique piece they've owned since their first apartment. Eyes full of concern, John turns around from filling the kettle at the sink, a routine he finds comforting. Jenny sits blankly, petting Marley, who rests his chin on her knee. As she starts to cry, she leans forward and hugs the big Labrador, the family's affectionate companion. John walks over and sits next to her, stroking her back, and she leans against him as he rubs her arm soothingly. A young dark-haired woman, Debbie, their trusted family friend, gets out carrying a bag and a suitcase, and Marley chases Debbie around the house trying to pull off her bath towel; he wins the mischievous game. Debbie offers the sedatives, prescribed by their vet for Marley's anxiety, and Marley's eating the sofa, his notorious habit when left unsupervised. The elderly Irish landlady, a warm-hearted woman with a love for traditional decor, leaves them to their quaintly decorated twin room, and John winces at the noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They kiss, snuggled in the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary, symbolic of Jenny's devout faith. A yellow taxi, a common sight in their bustling area, arrives at the Grogans' home, and the house is a chewed mess, evidence of Marley's reign during their absence. Marley stands at the front door, wagging his tail, and then stands with his head tilted back at a rain-lashed window, captivated by the storm. The dog runs under the desk where John's working on his latest article for a well-known magazine and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny comes out of the bathroom holding up a pregnancy kit, confirming the news they've long hoped for, and John takes her in his arms, lifting her clean off the floor in a whirlwind of joy. The Grogans are asleep as Marley busies himself chewing some of John's socks, a frequent morning annoyance, and then he headbutts open his food bin, knocking some classic literature books off a shelf in the process.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Marley jumps up at him but he pushes the dog aside. Jenny shrugs and slumps onto the sofa. Eyes full of concern John turns around from filling the kettle at the sink. Jenny sits blankly petting Marley who rests his chin on her knee. As she starts to cry she leans forward and hugs the big Labrador. John walks over and sits next to her stroking her back and she leans against him as he rubs her arm soothingly. A young darkhaired woman gets out carrying a bag and a suitcase and Marley chases Debbie around the house trying to pull off her bath towel. he wins the game. Debbie offers the sedatives and Marley's eating the sofa. The elderly Irish landlady leaves them to their quaintly decorated twin room and John winces at the noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They kiss snuggled in the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. A yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home and the house is a chewed mess. Marley stands at the front door wagging his tail and then stands with his head tilted back at a rainlashed window. The dog runs under the desk where John's working and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny comes out of the bathroom holding up a pregnancy kit and John takes her in his arms lifting her clean off the floor. The Grogans are asleep as Marley busies himself chewing some of John's socks and then he headbutts open his food bin knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Jenny takes a gold necklace out of a box but wagging his tail playfully. Marley gets the necklace. John trips on a chair and the chase is on around the living room. The dog easily outmaneuvers Jenny but John grabs him and forces open his jaws. John sprays Marley's poop with a hose looking for the necklace. The doctor holds a probe to Jenny's stomach and moves a scanner around on gel on Jenny's stomach. A fuzzy picture appears on a screen but the doctor frowns and removes the scanner then walks out leaving the Grogans waiting anxiously in the examination room. The doctor returns smiles reassuringly and places the scanner on Jenny's stomach. Debbie offers the sedatives and Marley's eating the sofa. The elderly Irish landlady leaves them to their quaintly decorated twin room and John winces at the noise of the springs as Jenny sits on the bed. They kiss snuggled in the floral quilt on Jenny's single bed beneath a portrait of the Virgin Mary. A yellow taxi arrives at the Grogans' home and the house is a chewed mess. Marley stands at the front door wagging his tail and then stands with his head tilted back at a rainlashed window. The dog runs under the desk where John's working and climbs onto John's lap. Jenny comes out of the bathroom holding up a pregnancy kit and John takes her in his arms lifting her clean off the floor. The Grogans are asleep as Marley busies himself chewing some of John's socks and then he headbutts open his food bin knocking some books off a shelf in the process.

Marley stands at the front door wagging his tail and then stands with his head tilted back at a rainlashed window. The dog runs under the desk where John's working and climbs onto John's lap. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Lucy grabs a silver bracelet from a basket, but twitching his ears curiously, Max retrieves the bracelet. Steve stumbles over a table and the sprint begins around the dining area. The cat easily outpaces Lucy, but Steve catches him and forces open his paws. Steve douses Max's litter with a sprinkler, searching for the bracelet. The nurse presses a thermometer to Lucy's arm and maneuvers a device across jelly on Lucy's arm. A blurry pattern emerges on a monitor, but the nurse scowls and sets aside the device, then exits, leaving the Bryants waiting nervously in the consulting room. The nurse returns, grins reassuringly, and positions the device on Lucy's arm. Lucy nods, pursing her lips, and the nurse retreats with an understanding nod of regret. Lucy glances at her partner, who's at a loss for words as they cruise down a pine tree-lined street. Steve looks at Lucy and tries to break the silence; without glancing at him, she reclines against her headrest and gazes out of the windshield. They continue down the sunlit highway toward the village. Back home, Steve unlocks the back gate for his partner. Max leaps up at him, but he nudges the cat away. Lucy sighs and collapses onto the recliner. Eyes full of empathy, Steve turns around from filling the mug at the faucet. Lucy sits dazedly, stroking Max, who lays his paw on her leg. As tears form, she leans over and embraces the big Persian cat. Steve walks over and sits next to her, patting her shoulder, and she leans against him as he rubs her hand gently. A young fair-haired man steps out carrying a backpack and a duffel bag, and Max follows Tim around the apartment trying to snatch his shower cap; he wins the contest. Tim provides the vitamins, and Max’s scratching the recliner. The elderly Scottish caretaker leaves them to their quaintly furnished double room, and Steve grimaces at the creak of the boards as Lucy sits on the mattress. They kiss, nestled in the floral blanket on Lucy's single mattress beneath a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi. A blue minivan pulls up at the Bryants' residence, and the apartment is a torn chaos. Max stands at the back gate, flicking his ears, and then stands with his eyes closed at a wind-swept window. The cat darts under the table where Steve's writing and curls up on Steve's lap. Lucy emerges from the bedroom holding up a fitness tracker, and Steve takes her in his arms, lifting her high off the ground. The Bryants are asleep as Max occupies himself tearing some of Steve's gloves, and then he headbutts open his toy bin, toppling some magazines off a shelf in the process.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jenny and John face a series of chaotic and emotional events involving their playful dog, Marley. As Jenny retrieves a gold necklace, Marley grabs it, leading to a chase around the living room until John retrieves it. At a doctor's appointment, the couple anxiously waits for results about Jenny's pregnancy. The doctor initially frowns but later reassures them, leaving the couple silent during their drive home. Back home, Jenny shows signs of distress, petting Marley as she cries. John comforts her, and they bond over the situation. Meanwhile, a visitor named Debbie arrives, and Marley causes mischief. The couple shares intimate moments in a quaint room and returns to a house in disarray due to Marley's antics. Amidst the chaos, Jenny announces her pregnancy, and John joyfully lifts her in celebration. As they sleep, Marley continues his playful destruction.
